d6QFqcopXJT9SKD6epZ6Eg.text: Waiting for a train at Charing Cross - popped out here for a quick coffee (the station doesn't have any place you can sit down for coffee).  Staff is distracted and perfectly content to discuss staff issues in loud enough voices by the front counter for everyone to hear.  Keep that stuff in the back, guys.

QDVwUkC3ad-J_XWvCG3Diw.text: Came to this place for the first time and had a really bad experience! The service sucks! The server who took our order was so rude and arrogant; she made us feel so uncomfortable. She treated the people seated besides us totally different, she smiled and attended their needs, while she ignored us and seemed my fiend and I were not here. She made us feel we were racially discriminated. The service totally destroyed the good food. Unbelievable!

Q2nKyo_nNRXsYg70j3n4VQ.text: My husband & I wandered into this place since we were hungry and wanted lunch.  Hubby had pesto chicken sandwich which he claimed was the worst he'd ever had.  It was lousy bread with no pesto flavor and a small piece of chicken.  We both shared the bruschetta bread which was a joke really.  They used rocket lettuce (instead of basil), cheap quality, flavorless bread and a lousy tomato. No garlic.  We said something to the Italian waitress who, being from Italy, understands what bruschetta bread is supposed to be!  I gave them two stars (vs one) because I ordered the ravioli which was decent, not great, but ok.  If this restaurant was in the Bay Area (California) where we live, it would quickly go out of business.  The expectation here is for high quality,  fresh breads and produce with organic, locally sourced ingredients when possible.  We ended up eating most lunches at Pret A Manager (fast food) while in London. They had much better food for a fraction of the price.

G-jM05tKbNpk2NGgRQE3DA.text: The Grilled Salmón Steak was delicious.  Merlot was decent and the ample serving of lentil soup was tasty. All for about 23 pounds. Staff was pleasant and catered to a very relax atmosphere with Italian music in the background.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom

1Qb14yGuHVtdoVFLpRydHA.text: Very good place for breakfast or dessert. We were pleasantly surprised with it after reading  all the negative reviews below  about rude staff and bad service. We came in at 10 am for a sit down breakfast. The staff was perfectly polite and efficient. The place has a beautiful spacious interior with quiet music. Their breakfast specials, such as traditional English breakfast, egg benedict or pancakes were reasonably priced at £5.95 and were of very good quality and presentation. Coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice were good too. We highly recommend it for spending a quiet 30-45 minutes before going on to a day of site seeing.

XnH5diQraRaqDNrwTSbuow.text: The services was awful.  The food is extremely over priced. Most annoyingly when you ask for water they charge four pounds without saying anything.

ynUbMp-EIGKcUqeUYgoVaw.text: While visiting London for our first time, we decided to have a nice meal and passed several restaurants before going into Caffe Concerto...we should have passed one more.  The staff was initially very nice but after ordering our fairly pricey meals, things went down hill.  The Lobster and Crab Ravioli came and the sauce that they used had a very fishy taste and wasn't like any other Lobster Ravioli we have ever had.  I had Mushroom Tortellini and the pasta was hard and either not cooked correctly or just a bad recipe.  We sent the Lobster Ravioli back and ordered soup and bread instead which was average at best.  We waited so long to get the check that we finally got up and went to find someone to take our money for the most disappointing dining experience we've had in a long time.  Nice ambiance, poor service, way below par food.

Wx5M743P7DeT9gJl66o2iA.text: Vito needs to be removed from this establishment immediately. Possibly the rudest person I have ever met. Check out the reviews on both Yelp and Google, there are many that refer to the unfriendly staff and based on my experience, I believe them to be accurate.

KNafkLfwpBj1jQgGo_oICw.text: Very disappointed with my experience here. The service was extremely slow, the staff was unfriendly and rushing us out of the door. Would not recommend

KW4vjoQz96Eex2u8iuCbqA.text: To be honest, we just went in initially to grab a quick snack. We just happened across it while walking around Trafalgar Square. We ended up staying and ate a full dinner. It was quite excellent. We had the ravioli, chicken Milanese and deserts. Service was very pleasant (perhaps a tad slow if you're in a hurry but we were not). Tiramisu and profiteroles were excellent.

xbnE0fOUsHBLuubWfl-k7A.text: So, there's a lot of Caffe Concerto's in London. But, this is my favorite.  It's set along a row of other chain restaurants across from Trafalgar Square and became my go to for a break or dinner when I was staying at a nearby hotel.  The atmosphere inside is very warm french brasserie, and the service is on top of the small roomThe window is filled with sweet patisserie creations - beautiful cakes, macaroon and tarts - which beckon in people for afternoon tea, which they do very well, and the treats are as good as they look.  The other food is equally good - and offers a good range of options.  It's the type of place that collects a diverse crowd and serves them all well from tea times, desserts and coffees to a well-cooked meal. I still occassionally find myself in there with a craving for their Salmon Nicoise Salad - always delivered with a perfectly grilled salmon steak on top. And, on top of all that it is very reasonable with reasonable prices on-going and special deals offered daily..TIP: It doesn't have wi-fi (it's major downfall), but if you sit on the right side you can pick up the one from the restaurant next door. .

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom

sxNgxh64h4RoSj375lrJog.text: Came here New Years Day, and would give it zero stars if the tiramisu wasn't actually pretty good. Service was atrocious and extremely slow. Ordered a double cheeseburger, and one of the burgers came back raw. Told the manager and waitress, neither of whom apologized or offered to refund for the undercooked food. Total ripoff, avoid at all costs

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. A "medium well" burger

cYs-3p7XSTJyNKruDxa8Xg.text: Deserves 0 stars if there was an option. Stay away!  Naively believed that a cafe is supposed to serve food that is ordered..Saw the cafe looking nice, there are 2 or 3 next to each other..3 or ya meant to have breakfast while on stopover in London..had to physically call for menu to be brought..then for waitress.. waitress (Cosmina- sp?) could not speak English to such extend that she would not understand an order, clearly stated on a menu "tea pot, English breakfast".. she was under impression that this means "breakfast" . This is TEA room in London, tea capital of the world!! Should've left, but we did not. Eventually, tea and 2 out of 3 eggs dishes were brought.. and napkins ..but no silverware! Flagging the waitress did not result in any attention. Some 5-10 min later I had to go inside and inquire about silverware (and this is waitress served place, so no self serve silverware anywhere). I asked about my son's breakfast order.. they looked around.. eventually said "2 minutes". Another 5 minutes later 3 red order still did not materialize. Not sure whether they thought that we should eat our meal while my son just sat - or wait and have our meal go cold - or just forgo his order. Talking to a girl making coffee got a comment that they are busy, and if I am unhappy with the waiter (who was talking to other people), I should just talk to her. Eventually, dish appeared, and manager was not apologetic, but was telling me how they are busy (well, say so, we would've gone next door!) , and how the waitress only works for a second day, and "other people also complain". I cancelled the pastries order, and went in to pay.. they attempted to charge gratuity!!! And were rude and snide and dismissive when I demanded to take this off! Beware!! (Food was OK, but I now have a heartburn after it, and I did not even finish the meal)

jdKHWBUh2M_yxWts7ljsbg.text: Expensiveeeeeee!I got a chicken club sandwich with avocado  on wheat bread which was tasty Husband got a prosciutto ciabattaAnd a beer and total was 57 pounds !!! I was happy with my sandwich bread was good husbands sandwich was skimpy. It came with French fries But 57 pounds?! For 2 sandwiches and a beer? I got tap waterAtmosphere was nice inside pretty chandeliers looks lovely for afternoon tea or some pastries

K26U-0tNHZQtTDwWJdLIPg.text: We popped in for a coffee and some snacks while walking around the area. It's a small coffee shop that also serves meals.The coffee was nice; however the scone I ordered never arrived. And the palmier my husband ordered was soggy.When the bill came they charged us for the scone. We asked for it to be removed, which they did. However no apology was given.With all the great coffee shops in the area, make your way to another.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. While the coffee was good, the pastries are not

JytCbtaaZVYHTpr3L-pmXg.text: Stopped by while walking around and decided to have tea and snacks. We got an afternoon tea complete with small sandwiches and scones and mini desserts. Yea was good as was the glass of prosecco. The decor is ornate however it was a good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom

dMIuHcqEpdVxKa0gCvoA8A.text: Came here for breakfast despite the reviews as was so close to hotel and cakes in the window looked so good. No complaints at all! Eggs bene, croissant, pancakes - all good. Service could maybe have been a bit faster and prices are high but then the location is amazing. Lovely decor. Would come back.

UMYaXkLeisal6yhVkOj2cA.text: Expensive and not worth it. We stopped by after the National Gallery for afternoon tea, when we asked the hostess about seating she informed us that if we were there for tea we couldn't be seated. We decided to stay and have both lunch and tea and were seated but I wish we had turned away. Once seated we heard/saw a waiter tell another young couple who asked for tea be guided to a table without question. We ordered an afternoon tea special for two and an order of fish and chips. The tea was nothing special and the sweets that came with the tea were awful. The scones were not fresh and were just heated in a microwave because after a couple of minutes  of having split one in two it went rock hard. The only acceptable thing about this place was the fish and chips.  Avoid if possible, I know it's close to Trafalgar Square and on the way to Westminster/parliament/big ben but you'll be doing yourself a favor if you stay away.

6r-jOpgU9kI6pDzSKLC38A.text: Came here after the service at Sherlock Holmes was horribly slow. Three stars for quick service. The Carbonara I ordered was delicious at first but then became too cheesy for my liking. I had to put tons of pepper just to put more flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. Carbonara

KHNuVDYU0750pPYgvfN8eA.text: Rude staff.  All they care is if you spend.  Yes I understand if toilets are not for public use.  I ask where the closest one would be and response is 5 pounds.  That is uncalled for.

5QVW5LOnzwEnhanM1LIvHw.text: We were planning to go to Harrods to have the typical afternoon tea and we walked by this place and suddenly changed our mind. The place is very nice and I think the food was good as this was the first time we tried the tea. My low rate it's because few minutes after we arrived the place was full and the personnel was panicking and couldn't keep up. The couple that arrived just after us was waiting for their order to be taken after we received our food. A man in another table received a wrong order. One of the waitress was arguing with the kitchen personnel.  The girl that received us at the door suddenly dissapeared after another waiter argued her because she brought the wrong menus to our table. It was very amusing to see this mess but the place was too nice.

_iTuL2-SfEa0BsHqHkEtjg.text: Terrible service rude staff food was so so. I think I feed my dog better. The only nice thing to be said about this place is how gorgeous it is decorated! Beware!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. Amazing decoration that is all

Z088Mvpu1HYCcmND07LVVQ.text: Ordered the seafood salad, concerto pizza and apple tard. The avocado in the seafood salad are chunky . Salad from Tesco is better.The pizza is a cheese pizza with the figs and beets sprinkled on later. Very stingy on the ingredient and overall too dry.Crust on the tard is too soft.Overall, don't step in here unless u have to or u haven't see the review yet. It is a two star on help for a very good reason.

10mfEeza0tDP9OLTh83r1g.text: This is my 1st review lower than 3 stars. I had a cup of tea and a slice of Strawberry Gateaux(to go/take away). They charged £10.50 for the tea and £2.95 for the cake. The tea with 2 Tetley  tea bags in a paper cup cost £10.50!! That's bloody mad!!!!!! Cake was awesome and I would have paid more for the cake. Overall, I don't think the cashiers or waiters are honest people. Stay away from this establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. London's most expensive tea with 2 Tetley tea bags!

El0xglTbiHnR2wB0oNDYBw.text: Great little place next to our hotel. We stopped several times for coffees and desserts.  My son is a tiramisu lover, trying it everywhere we go.  He said that this was his favorite ever.

jKz17o7XZdcWIexsYb0JnA.text: Went late sept2016. The environment was amazing with live pianist singer, and classy english dinning chandeliers decorations.Dispite this, the food was very disappointing. Ordered the duck breast pear salad, brocoli soup and the lobster crab raviolis. The soup came soon enough, but the remaining courses came 30minutes after the soup. When the courses did come, the raviolis were not fully cooked while the duck breast was overly cooked to duck jerky, both of which had a good sauce though. I requested a new plate for the duck breast salad, and received a better dish afterwards.All in all I finished the meal after an unexpected 2.5 hours, perhaps understaffed kitchen? I cant comment.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. Duck breast n pear salad (after change)
Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. Lobster crab raviolis
Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. Duck beast n pear salad (before changed)

kqGz0Uukc0_UgOSBAL2WFw.text: I don't understand why some places here in London will not sell any item individually in their menu, and you need to buy the whole food. I think that is a waste of food. I came to this place to have breakfast and it was good,  but they did not want to sell me a order of eggs with my croissant. So I had to order the croissant without eggs. But, I have to admit that the food my family had was pretty good and they were pleased. Overall, nice a place.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. Croissants
Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes

k8m1lIAkFqK4aMfyA-hj4w.text: Nice little place with lots of history and ambiance. We came in when it was quiet around 3pm.  Great food and service. We ordered insalata caprese, seafood salad and Milanese sandwich.  OMG freshest mozzarella I've  I had in a long time  The only knock is that waitresses were seen picking up dessert items without any tongs or gloves.  No, we didn't get any dessert.

NKLmyVS6UhGTyfN96YtfVA.text: Pretty decor so you'd think it'd be good food but it wasn't. Terrible service and it was all really expensive for what you get! Not coming back ever.

L8lhnWykLEBRpBkmZ0M_vQ.text: This place is fantastic and I am disappointed with the rating it has.  Spent a week in London and stayed close by at the Grand hotel.  Had numerous meals here and were always pleased with the quality and flavors of the dishes as well as the staff.  Anna and Christina seemed to be there every time we stopped in.One night, coming back after a long day of sightseeing my daughter wanted to have a chocolate milkshake. Anna informed us that they were closing but proceeded to make my daughter her milkshake in a to-go cup. They were always friendly and accommodating any time we were there.The  two tables located outside were perfect for sitting, having afternoon tea with scones, and people watch.  They have a large selection of pastries, scones, cakes, and other assortment of sweet treats.  The display of these was done at the front of the cafe meant to entice the passerby to come in relax and enjoy. I highly recommend this restaurant and staff.  The location of this restaurant is perfect for having a delicious breakfast before heading out to see the numerous sites that London has to offer. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. Anna, our friendly waitress who was always a pleasure to have breakfast with!!
Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. Christina, morning manager.

phFufjGC8SLmOoHl-Dq9Gg.text: During our visit to London last week we dined at Caffé Concerto twice because we so enjoyed the food, tea, service and atmosphere.  We requested to be seated at a small table at the front of the restaurant where the windows are open so we could dine al fresco.  So charming!

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom

6-teK_yOD24IopERTo1zSA.text: Close to Parliament / Big Ben. I got the Chicken & Asparugus. My wife got Rigatoni Concerto. If you get off at Piccadilly Square there is another Caffe Concerto.It can get busy. The service is extremely slow. If you want a milkshake, this is not the place to get one. Their milkshakes are more like strawberry quik.The first time I came we were the only ones here which was nice. The king prawns with spaghetti was delicious. Not too greasy.

mKIhraCODeIpndHUbKdSTA.text: We stopped to grab a late lunch after a long walk around the area. It was quite busy and the host seemed to be turning away people only interested in getting coffee and/or dessert. I felt that was a little rude esp given that it was snowing outside. Anyway, we were seated promptly. The decor is quite classy, loved the chandeliers and painted walls. But too noisy. Definitely not the place for a formal meeting.Coming to the food - ordered a pizza, which was quite good. Also ordered red wine which seemed a little off, almost like the bottle had been open too long. Overall an average experience. Wouldn't mind going again to try coffee & desserts. And could definitely go back for the pizza

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom

bVb-u08Go26ejn1QfjumFA.text: Fancy schmancy! We didn't really plan on eating here but after a long walk we needed a loo & a snack break. Somehow ended up in front of Caffe Concerto.The exterior was very nice. Beautiful chandeliers & mirrors. We were promptly seated. My husband ordered  the egg in the nest dish & I ordered the traditional tea service. I didn't realize how much food I would have to deal with! Several sandwiches, muffins & desserts. My husband gave me a helping hand.Everything tasted marvelous.Many people are complaining about prices in their reviews but what did they expect in the center of London at this type of establishment, a "Happy Meal" ? Come on!

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. Egg in the nest or something like that
Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful expterior
Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. Tea service for 1!

94zgPNguCKGitxiuUrra4A.text: The "super food" salad didn't taste like anything and the service was not good. Also ordered the red velvet cake that was raspberry flavored? It was made very well but i was dry and you could tell it was sitting out for days. Also said they had watermelon ice cream but they didn't.The interiors were pretty and pastries looked appealing however.No wifi.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom

M3UpyWRJKXBjFVHNSnf2yQ.text: I came here for breakfast since I was walking around Trafalgar Square and it was raining so I wanted to go somewhere close by.  This place looked like a classic European cafe so decided to check it out.  We ordered the English breakfast (eggs, hash brown, bacon, beans, mushrooms, roasted tomato, and toast) and scones with jam/clotted cream.  The food was decent.  I wish the scones were warmer.  The English breakfast was a lot of food - filling but underseasoned.  The prices were pretty good - the English breakfast was discounted (6.50 pounds vs. 8.95 pounds) so it was a good deal.  The service was not exactly friendly and the staff don't really speak English that well.  Other than that, it was an okay meal in a touristy area.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. English breakfast

cMMscpHhezYJdlmQGLoN8A.text: As we sat in caffe concerto deciding on what kinds of pasta to pair with which kinds of sauce, outside there was a concerto of protesters marching down the street. People with all sorts of signs and kids and jackets marched through the rain along what seemed like a parade. Drums beat, horns blared. And it was only after some time of studying this strange procession that I came to realize it was meant to be a protest. None like I had ever seen before. Relatively peaceful, nicely cordoned off to a lane dedicated to itself, and ultimately with a relatively happy and upbeat fanfare not relegated to what I would expect to be an mob wielding pitchforks. Then I began to think - have we as a society come so far as to normalize a protest? I had recently participated in the walk to defeat ALS in NYC with my family and this seemed more like that than the Black Lives Matter protests down the streets of NYC. But with neo-liberal yuppies heading to protests as if they were extra-curricular activities - is it starting to normalize into a Saturday afternoon activity as these kind people were doing outside in the streets?The inside of Caffe Concerto beamed with bright lights and fancy chandeliers. My friend who brought me called it: "the kind of restaurant that makes you SEEM fancy when you sit in it and eat." We sat and ate pasta, chocolate cake, prawns, and mushroom soup to the accompaniment of the fanfare / protest / celebration of protest just outside our window.Ultimately, the food was 3/5 so there's that too.

BLfz_a7T5rqrxHH0lFu9Pg.text: Nice breakfast place next to trafalgar square.  Very European feel, service is quick although most of the staff speak English as a second language so be clear on what you are ordering.  I had the English breakfast which was nice, everything prepared perfectly and done quickly.   I ate there three times and enjoyed a number of pastries as well which were excellent.  Good food, good prices, good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom

fL8KuY7w8qx7IY_kGNPeSQ.text: I was actually chasing after an afternoon tea bus tour by B Bakery that happens to pick up customers nearby this tea place that is close to Trafalgar Square. Realizing that you have to book in advance to join in on the fun we didn't end up doing going on the Afternoon tea bus tour. We were still hungry though, and were craving some afternoon tea.As we looked further ahead on Northumberland Ave. we noticed a tea room. The display outside was actually quite appetizing with cakes, tarts, pastries, and anything you can imagine to try as you sip your cuppa. Mesmerized by the huge display of pretty cakes and tarts we decided to give it a tryWe had the afternoon tea set and it was okay. It came with 2 raisin scones + whipped butter, a raspberry macaroon, chocolate mousse cake, strawberry cake, and a cheesecake lemon cup with layer of graham on the bottom. The scones were okay but a bit dry. I felt that they would have tasted better if served warm as well. After trying all the sweets I think the chocolate mousse cake was my favourite as it was dense and rich but good. The strawberry mousse cake was good too but it was a little too sour. You get to choose a tea as well so I ordered a blueberry fruit tea to try that comes in a pyramid shaped tea bag for you to steep.It was great value for the amount of sweets and cakes that you get but it can be really sweet and filling if you try to finish it all in one sitting.We decided to get a side of tapa like appetizers to share as well.The overall experience was okay. The interior is like the lobby of an opera house and has chandeliers everywhere. Decent place but would probably try a different place next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon tea set
Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. Blueberry fruit tea

jAm3UgWeaaKyDfwxhLbJKw.text: Be aware upfront, no air conditioning. You will not escape the heat here. The rating is 1 1/2 but I don't have the option. Ordered a simple eclair with chantilly cream. They were out at 2PM. Not kidding. It's not that hard to make but evidently it stumped the kitchen on making more especially when they still had hours of operating time left. My wife ordered tea with the finger sandwiches. Nothing much there either. Ambience was tough to enjoy because again it was hot and no type of air circulation unless you create your own.

E7zBTplGzjb7Kk14mrt0ww.text: Eggs florentine was delicious, Fast service! Came in  here for a quick bite, it did not disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom

kQ-lQG81caDkwr_UG5WjXA.text: Afternoon set was $18.xx with champagne. We order one and eat it as lunch and can't finish it for 2 people.  Their dessert is good. Scone is ok, served warm. Excellent value and nice decor inside. They make wedding cakes and their dessert are better than average.They ask if we want table outside or not, and check for good table for us. The guys were friendly. One lady we talk to is a bit cold.People will refill our tea without us asking and don't give us a look when we ask share a tea set. I feel they are friendly at their service. We saw other has chicken salad and that looks good with chicken breast and good portion Caesar salad for 12.xx€.Good value overall outside the National Gallery and St James Park.There is no free toilet in London, not even in train station. People want to borrow bathroom for free does not give fair review.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. Sandwiches : salmon, egg, ham, cucumber
Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. Scones, served warm. Not the best I had. Best one was in Las Vegas interestingly.
Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. Dessert we had. Macaroon with raspberry. Strawberry mousse cake and another mousse cake.

VuQ9M79LeJrQYm4TuKvJYw.text: Avoid this place. The service was poor and the restaurant was not even busy. I told my wife that it takes a lot people to provide such poor service. I had the billionaires cake. It tasted stale. My wife had the lemon cheesecake which was very good.  Our tea and coffee were good but the poor service and pretty high prices made it a one star. Would not recommend or ever come back.

DjI2RaSjaHoGtZ5s8b13og.text: Very slow service. Food was just ok but not a good value. They add on a mandatory tip

zfrBYaTU-47JypAibUdm9Q.text: One of the biggest selections of pasteries I have ever seen.  Had the lemon cheesecake, wife had a breakfast croissant.  Both very good.    Proper proportions on the food,  no massive amounts that you can not eat.  Nice and clean, including the bathrooms. REAL air conditioning!

RD6qjw7lsjnG_QFdMaPvMQ.text: My husband and I were staying at a hotel just down from here and ended up purchasing dessert from them just about every night while visiting London. Between my husband and me, we ate about 18 Macaroons, a Tiramisu cup, the Strawberry Gâteaux, Éclair Chocolate Crème, Chocolate Mousse, and the Mixed Berries Mousse. Everything was fresh and delicious. We came so frequently that we chatted up the one man who seemed to be working the counter every night. He informed us that they have about eight locations just in central London with one bakery making the desserts fresh every morning for all of them. If you find yourself in the area and have a sweet tooth, I recommend you getting a take-away of one of their lovely desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. Desserts
Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom. Drinks
Photo of Caffe Concerto - London, United Kingdom

T4__9I9oL3IJs9EAgrYgAQ.text: Stopped for lunch Service was ok. Waiter was a little pushy The food was ok nothing remarkableBut what really got me was 25 pounds for 6 ice teas Out bill was 87 pounds with the tip.Plus they all came with almost no ice. Maybe it's just a London thing.

SKayBTu0pc3cgRgOBT5mzQ.text: Coming in to the restaurant, they rushed us to sit down and while we ordered, the server also seemed very impatient as well. We finished ordering and the food came out in a decent amount of time, but they forgot some of the food we ordered...i ordered the strawberries and banana pancakes were a little tough but the blueberry yogurt was delicious! I'd say food is the highlight but the service was awful...we ordered water in the beginning but didn't get it until the end. Very disappointed.

3kNyuv9a1RG6JPN6F_KfSA.text: Don't recommend this place. We'd asked for two different type's of cake (5.65£ each). Unfortunately, the one was out of order. No problem, we decide to take ONE and split it. Guess what happened next, he brought 2 same cakes. I didn't want to argue with him...so we kept both and ate it. When my bill arrived (12.65£) I'd asked a waiter if a service charge was included. his answered "yes", but If i want he could remove it. I'd told him to keep the money... next thing that I saw after payment been processed was 14.65£. A waiter put extra 2£ tip for himself, without asking me. And of course I found it right away... The guy was offering me 2£ "refund"... I couldn't believe that.Never go back again!
